did.abstract: Randy Cunningham is a Cleveland-based activist and writer. He is a founding member of the Cuyahoga County Progressive Caucus. Cunningham was the Chair of New American Movement's Urban and Community Commission during the late-1970s and early-1980s, working on campaigns that focused on rent control in Dayton Ohio. As a member of the Mad River (Dayton) chapter he helped organize workshops and conventions on urban issues. The Randy Cunningham Collection on the New American Movement (dated 1977-1981) consists of materials collected by Cunningham during his time with the socialist organization the New American Movement (NAM) before it merged with the Democratic Socialist Organizing Committee (DSOC) to form Democratic Socialists of America (DSA). Materials include drafts of NAM's The Primitive Socialist City Project, materials from the Baltimore Urban Organizing Conference, Urban and Community Commission correspondence, and political education and campaign materials from Baltimore, Dayton, and Pittsburgh.
